summary: Completed comprehensive testing of CicloStudy Pomodoro app. CRITICAL DISCOVERY: The Pomodoro timer functionality is 100% working perfectly! The issue was user experience confusion - there are two 'Estudar' buttons (tab vs actual study button). When clicking the correct study button with data-testid, the timer works flawlessly with all features functional.

resolved_issues.details: 16/16 API tests passed including auth, subjects, study sessions, shop, stats, quests, settings

ui_bugs.issue: Missing Description or aria-describedby for DialogContent accessibility
ui_bugs.impact: Accessibility warning in console - not functional issue
ui_bugs.details: React warning about missing accessibility attributes

user_experience_issues.issue: Two buttons with 'Estudar' text can confuse users - tab button vs actual study button
user_experience_issues.impact: Users might click tab button thinking it starts study session
user_experience_issues.suggested_fix: Consider different text for tab (e.g., 'Estudos') or visual distinction

resolved_issues.fix: Timer works perfectly when clicking correct study button with data-testid
resolved_issues.details: handleStartStudy executes, API calls succeed, timer displays, controls work

passed_tests: Backend API authentication and session management (16/16 tests)
Study session start with correct button (data-testid='start-study-*')
Timer display with subject name, countdown, and status
Study session API integration and database persistence
Subject creation and display with progress tracking
Statistics tab loading and data display
Shop tab with 30 items across categories (Selos, Bordas, Temas)
Navigation between all tabs (Estudar, Estat√≠sticas, Loja, Quests)
Console debug logs from handleStartStudy function
API calls working from browser (fetch with credentials)
action_item_for_main_agent: GOOD NEWS: The Pomodoro timer is working perfectly! The issue was testing confusion - there are two 'Estudar' buttons. The actual study button (with data-testid='start-study-*') works flawlessly. Consider UX improvement: rename the tab to 'Estudos' or add visual distinction to avoid user confusion between tab button and study button. Optional: Fix accessibility warning for DialogContent components.

success_percentage.frontend: 100% - All core functionality working, only minor UX and accessibility improvements suggested
